caption.p: Bootstrap overfitting-corrected calibration curve. Estimated for the four prognostic models: parsimonious (A), parsimonious without body temperature (B), clinical-only (C), and minimal (D). Each plot contains the rug chart at the top showing the distribution of predicted risks. The dotted line represents the apparent calibration curve and the solid line shows the optimism-corrected calibration. A perfectly-calibrated model will fall along the diagonal. Generated with the calibrate function in the rms package.
